body.name: Shark Scrub + Steam Blaster, 7.48'' x 14.96'' x 47.44'', Rose Gold/Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 21 hrs 50 mins
features: POWERFUL PERFORMANCE: Powerful steam and rotating pads provide up to 3x better stuck-on stain removal vs. traditional steam mops**.
STEAM BLASTER: A powerful and targeted steam blast that is controlled at touch of finger to provide even more steam power for stubborn stains and spots.
EASE OF USE: Rotating pads deliver over 150 scrubs per minute, providing an effortless glide and a smooth cleaning experience—the pads do all the work.
FINGERTIP UI: Easily control steam modes and activate Steam Blaster through the handle.
3 STEAM MODES: Light, for quick cleanups; Normal, for everyday use; and Deep, for stuck-on messes and stains.
LED HEADLIGHTS: Powerful LED headlights reveal hidden debris around your home.
DESIGNED FOR ALL SEALED HARD FLOORS: Hardwood, marble, tile, stone, laminate, vinyl.
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Shark Steam & Scrub Hard Floor Steam Mop, 4 DIRT GRIP Soft Scrub washable pads, & Filling flask.
body.description: The Shark Steam & Scrub with Steam Blaster Technology scrubbing and sanitizing* steam mop gently scrubs and sanitizes* all at once. The combination of steam and rotating pads delivers up to 3x better stuck-on stain removal vs. traditional steam mops**

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Quality product
reviews.reviewText: We have a standard "Shark" steam mop (lift away model) and we love it however it does require more strength to use it. So, when we saw this on sale during the "Prime Days" we thought why not give it a try and we are so happy we did. This steam mop works so much better then to other one. The rotating mop heads scrub and steam very well even the grout now gets cleaned way more than we could have imagined. Top notch and solid quality construction, very durable and easy to use. We love the port for adding water, very smart design and easy to fill. It is actually very fun to use compared to the previous model. This mop simply glides across the floor and does a good job scrubbing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I should have gotten sooner
reviews.reviewText: I had a standard "Shark" steam mop before ordering this one and my wife and I loved it. The only square head "Shark" steam mop worked very well for 3 years then just stopped steaming. So we went without for a while and we missed the sanitation and clean the steam mop does.So when we saw this on sale during the "Prime Days" we jumped and purchased. We are so happy we did. This thing works so well. We love how it cleans our floors. The rotating mop heads scrub and steam very well. We love that the cleaning pads are removable and easy to wash by just throwing them in the washer and dryer.Seems very durable and is easy to use. It is actually very fun to use. It glides across the floor and does a good job scrubbing. My floors have never been more sanitary.This will not replace a mop for spills and clean ups but it does a great job of sanitizing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m new to the steam mop game but this thing is amazing! I have a larger home so I need to fill the water basin often but I love how clean my floors get! And the spinning scrubber is self propelled like a lawn mower so it takes very little effort to move it around. Dries super quick and the scrubbers are removable and washable. So easy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I'm really impressed with how easy it is to use, and how great it cleans my floors. Well worth the investment at a great price point!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing works.
reviews.reviewText: I saw the cheaper version of this steam mop (without the Blaster extra steam feature) well reviewed on a consumer site, so I decided to get Shark's top-of-the-line, assuming it would be even better. It's a great steam mop. I've had three steam mops now, two without motorized heads, now one with motorized pads.This mop beats the others in three important ways:1) Much more steam. It produces double the steam of other mops, even at intermediate level. At blaster level, it rocks steam. And you can inject spray by a hand trigger in addition to the auto steam feed.2) The powered rotating heads are no gimmick. They work, and well. And the mop heads don't come off as easily as the rectangular mop heads on my previous steam mops.3) Finally, it may seem a small thing, but the six extra feet of cord this mop has versus my previous mop make all the difference in the world in convenience of use.I STRONGLY commend this mop to anyone considering it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love that it scrubs & steams!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had a shark steamer for 10 years and it still works great. We needed a steamer for our camper so I bought a little cheap one that wasn’t worth a crap. Ended up returning that one and just putting our old one in the camper. We ordered this one to replace the one in our home and it’s awesome! If you have dogs, get this. Love that it scrubs and steams at the same time!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Got dust and dogs, get this!
reviews.reviewText: I have a dusty old home. Even living in the humid midwest I have to dust two-three times a week and then I add my 2 dogs and a cat to the mix and I’ve got the perfect mix for constant dirty floors.The puppies track in mud, dirt, leaves and sticks, you name it. The cat leaves his fur and litter wherever he chooses. And the dust. Well. It dusts. Everything.I have a normal steam mop that I’ve loved for so long but it can’t handle the fine dust along with the other asks that I have of it. And I noticed it during a deep clean of the hardwood stairs (oh. yes. did I mention. hardwood everywhere!) that the very next day a fine layer of dust still existed. It was like my perfect steam mop hadn’t made a dent.So on the hunt I went for something that would lift up dust and dirt and fur (I do vacuum 3-5x a week as well). I tried a cross wave but it got clogged in 10 seconds flat. And while it might be good for a one pet household or I need one of the bigger versions, it felt like more of a inconvenience for me.So back on the hunt I went.And then this Shark showed up and I couldn’t stop lusting after it.And so one day in a crazed state (it was late at night, I couldn’t sleep thinking about the dusty) I bought it.I waited with bated breathe and couldn’t wait to use it!It’s perfect. My floors will never be fully clean but this easily lifts up the dust and the dirt. I’m glad I got the stepped up version with the steam stream or whatever it’s called bc that really helps with the tile and the dirt that gets stuck to the floor but if you don’t have all wood and tile or 3 four legged creatures who let your share their home OR your home isn’t amazingly dusty, then likely you could get away with the basic version.I’ve used this several times and love how easy it is to use, get started, fill up, attach the pads, and wash the pads. I have had very few issues with it (except the one time I flew too close to the sun and it tore my internet cord out of my wall, but that’s fully my own fault, not fault of the mop)The one and only con I have is that I think it’s so dumb the tank is not detachable. If Shark and Bissell had a baby steam mop, that would be the perfect steam mop. I have to use this steam mop until the tank is empty even if I’m doing a small space bc I refuse to pick it up and dump the water back into the sink.This is one issue I always have with Shark. I looooove that they’re such a dupe for Dyson, I just wish their design for convenience was a little better.That said, I’m 1000% satisfied with my purchase and 12/10 recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shark steam mop
reviews.reviewText: Lightweight and easy to use. Could use a little more scrubbing power but overall very good device

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: shark is one amazing products going!. but I was so disappointed to receive the shark ninja steam mop, with a 2 pin plug attached.There was not uk plug on itso I could not use it, hence why I am returning the product.I ATTACHED THE HANDLE BEFORE I SEE THE 2 PIN PLUG, SO I COULD NOT DISMANTLE THE THE HANDLE.SO IT IS WRAPPED UP WITH TWO BOXES IN ON BLENDED TOGETHER, SO ITS A EXTRAA LONG BOX.KIND REGARDS MICHELLE

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Useless, no plug and is a USA model so can’t easily and safely find a way to use it. Unable to take the handle out to pack up again for the return as so stiffAppalling experience

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not supplied with a UK plug.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Does not work in the UK.
reviews.reviewText: This item is 👎 use in the UK as it comes from America and you can not use it as we have a Different electricity supply so then you will have to get a Transformer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Unsuitable for sale in the UK
reviews.reviewText: The product came fitted with a US mains plug, which does not work in the UK even with an adaptor. In order to return the item I had to disassemble the handle, to repack it, which is incredibly difficult. Amazon were very unhelpful when I explained the situation.The product looks as though it would have been good if I could have used it - I was very disappointed, by this experience.
